text: What is gravity?
Stunned silence.
Any order?
No just jump in please.
I wish we really knew. So I mean we can certainly... it's easy
enough to describe properties of gravity.
It's enough to describe theories of gravity
we've had too marvelous theories but
"what is" for somebody like me raises question marks
and not the answers that we already know.
So in a deep sense we don't think we know the
answer that because of some other things
will be probably discussing later but in
a practical sense if I want to send a
moon...
If I want to send a rocket to the moon
we know precisely what is gravity.
or by the way if i want to
calculate the ripples the waves that
might move the arms of LIGO by a
fraction of the size of the proton.
I can also calculate that. So we have a pretty
good practical understanding of gravity
but conceptually I don't know.
That's one of the ideas I want to introduce to
the audience is that this thing that we
take for granted that we live with,
we don't even think about accepted when
it's in headlines is something that we don't
really know what it is and Kip Thorne's
answer was it's a meaningless question
(laughter)
